page.title: 10MAIDENS HALL HOUSE,ROXWELL
page.content: Two people live at Maidens Hall. No children live with them. They are retired. Their hobbies are watching cricket and Rugby, photography, making wine and Gardening. The man who lives there is a member of the following cricket clubs; MCC, ECC, RCC and LCC. They grow vegetables of their own. Milk, newspapers and post are delivered regularly, but no mobile shops come round. They do their shopping in Chelmsford and Roxwell. They have one cat. There have been extensions on the house. The house has been bought off the owners of nearby Newland Hall. It is 150 years old. The walls are made of part timber and part brick. The roof is made of tile. They have 2 cars. It used to be 2 houses. The real Maidens Hall has long been demolished.The people had a dog but it died.
